national_indicator_available: Growth rate of people experiencing chronic homelessness
indicator_name: Growth rate of people experiencing chronic homelessness
target_name: Reduce chronic homelessness by at least 31% by March 2024
national_indicator_description:
The indicator measures the growth rate of people experiencing chronic homelessness.
Refers to individuals who are currently experiencing homelessness AND who meet at least one of the following criteria:
1) they have a total of at least 6 months (180 days) of homelessness over the past year;
2) they have recurrent experiences of homelessness over the past 3 years, with a cumulative duration of at least 18 months (546 days). (Reaching Home: Canada’s Homelessness Strategy Directives)
graph_title: Growth rate of chronic homelessness in Canada

graph_annotations.description: A target labelled target 2024 crosses the graph at -31%.

source_url_text_1: Employment and Social Development Canada.  Custom tabulation.
